div.p: $vol$ builds $pat$, a building or ship. ** (inchoative) $vol$ establishes, founds, begins construction on $pat$ ** $vol$ nominates $dat$ for public office.
(reflexive) $pat$ and $pat$ are of the same clan.
$pat$ is boiling. ** $vol$ cooks, boils $pat$. ** $vol$ bothers, startles $pat$.
$vol$ searches for $dat$. ** $vol$ wants $dat$. ** (perfective) $vol$ finds $dat$. ** $vol$ meets, meets up with $dat$. ** $vol$ invents, creates $pat$. ** $vol$ receives $pat$.
$vol$ pierces, stings, stabs $pat$ with $ins$. ** $vol$ inserts $ins$ into $all$. ** (vulgar) $vol$ penetrates $pat$.
$vol$ fights. ** (reflexive) $vol$ and $vol$ fight against one another. ** (frequentative, literary) $vol$ struggles against, slaughters $pat$.
Father’s son. ** Heir, beneficiary (of estate), successor.
$vol$ speaks, says $pat$, a word (not a whole phrase). ** $vol$ speaks about $dat$. ** $vol$ speaks to, tells $all$. ** (frequentative) $vol$ commands, is in charge.
$vol$ (a person) blows, exhales on $all$. ** (frequentative) $vol$ (a wind) blows, gusts.
To lie, to be (with prepositional phrase) (stative)
To lie, to be (with prepositional phrase)
To lie, to be (with prepositional phrase)
Heel. ** With, together (used in positional constructions). ** (modal prefix) Together.
Part, component. ** (modal prefix) Partially, incompletely, somewhat.
$vol$ adds $pat$ onto $all$. ** (reflexive) $ins$ grows, increases. (frequentative) $vol$ loads $pat$, cargo.
$vol$ eats $pat$. ** (frequentative) $pat$ is a part of $vol$’s diet.
$ins$ (inanimate) is warm, mild. ** $pat$ (animate) feels warm, comfortable. ** $vol$ (animate) is affectionate, friendly, relaxed.
$pat$ stands. ** $pat$, a formally animate noun, exists (used with adpositional statements).
$vol$ is wise. ** (inchoative, typically religious) $vol$ instructs or presents a revelation to $ins$.
$vol$ drinks, swallows $pat$. ** $vol$ inhales, smokes $pat$. ** (frequentative) $vol$ slurps, sucks $pat$. ** (vulgar) $vol$ performs oral sex on $pat$.
$pat$ is yellow. ** $pat$ is exuberant, spontaneous, fun. ** (inchoative) $pat$ cuts loose, gets high.

$vol$ carries, holds $pat$ with difficulty. ** $vol$/$loc$ contains, is pregnant with $pat$. ** $pat$ is heavy, serious, burdensome. ** $pat$ is difficult for $vol$. ** (perfective) $vol$ gives birth to $pat$. ** $vol$ conceives $pat$.
$vol$ touches, feels $pat$. ** $vol$ affects, disturbs $pat$. ** (frequentative) $vol$ strikes, hits $pat$.
Aunt, uncle. ** Any indirect relative of an older generation.
Eldest brother, heir. ** Boss, big-man, chief.
(reflexive) $vol$ studies $dat$. ** (reflexive) $ins$ learns $dat$ through experience. ** $vol$ teaches $ins$ about $dat$.
$vol$ opens, unlocks, $pat$. ** $vol$ releases, turns loose $pat$. $vol$ frees, surrenders $pat$.
(reflexive) $ins$ grows, ages. ** $pat$ expands in size. ** (reflexive) $ins$ ripens. ** $vol$ cultivates, rears $ins$, an agricultural product.
To cover, to hang, to drape. (stative)
To cover, to hang, to drape. Cloud; curtain; spider's web.
To cover, to hang, to drape.

$vol$ looks at, watches $dat$. ** (vulgar) $vol$ has sex with, fucks $pat$. ** (inceptive) $vol$ catches sight of $dat$. ** $vol$ meets $dat$. ** (frequentative) $vol$ understands, comprehends, empathizes with $dat$, a person or idea.
